required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Level of Neuromuscular Blockade
clinical_study.official_title: Effect to Gastrointestinal Barrier Function During Laparoscopic Gastrectomy With Deep vs Moderate Neuromuscular Blockade.

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: On the basis of moderate pneumoperitoneum pressure(10 mmHg), this study evaluates the effect of different level of neuromuscular blockade to gastrointestinal barrier function during laparoscopic gastrectomy. 60 patients are randomized to 2 arms ,The patients in deep NMB（PTC=1-2）will receive high dose rocuronium ;While the patients in moderate NMB（TOF=1-2）will receive moderate dose rocuronium.

detailed_description.textblock: Different level of neuromuscular blockade can affect the demand of pneumoperitoneum pressure,while high level of pneumoperitoneum pressure may cause some damage to gastrointestinal barrier which is important to the recovery of the patient. In this study,we will evaluate the effect of different level of neuromuscular blockade to the barrier by DAO and D-lactic in plasma, the microstructural changes of intestinal tract will be observed under scanning electron microscope and the recovery of intestinal function will be recorded.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before operation,1 day after operation
primary_outcome.description: The level of D-lactic can indicate the damage to the gastrointestinal barrier .
The integrated microstructure of jejunum is the primary of its function，so microstructure of the jejunum will be observed under the SEM and light microscope.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before operation,1 day after operation
primary_outcome.description: The level of DAO can indicate the damage to the gastrointestinal barrier .
It's a regular measurement to evaluate the function of gastrointestinal tract .

arm_group.description: patients undergoing elective laparoscopic surgery for gastrectomy were randomized to receive deep neuromuscular blockade (post-tetanic count 1-2) using high dose rocuronium.
patients undergoing elective laparoscopic surgery for gastrectomy were randomized to receive moderate neuromuscular blockade (train-of-four 1-2) using moderate dose rocuronium.

intervention.intervention_name: Rocuronium Bromide, 50 Mg/5 mL Intravenous Solution
intervention.description: 60 patients receiving laparoscopic gastrectomy surgery are randomized to two arms(30 patients per arm). The patients in deep NMB（PTC=1-2）receive high dose rocuronium ;the patients in moderate NMB(TOF=1-2) receive moderate dose rocuronium.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital with Nanjing Medical University
